item.dc:creator: @Blazziin Blazziin
item.description:
@Blazziin wrote:

[size=12pt]Welcome to my very first tut!:P[/size]
Diffculty:1/10 just for begineers so dont spam/flamm me!
Files modified:Client.java

open client.java and search for

public void NewObjects()

You should see somthing like this:

makeGlobalObject(3024, 3708, 2213, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(3025, 3708, 2213, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(3026, 3708, 2213, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(3027, 3708, 2213, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(3568, 9677, 1747, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2855, 3441, 2213, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2832, 3439, 2213, -1, 10); makeGlobalObject(2832, 3438, 2213, -1, 10); makeGlobalObject(2832, 3437, 2213, -1, 10); makeGlobalObject(2832, 3436, 2213, -1, 10); makeGlobalObject(2832, 3435, 2213, -1, 10); makeGlobalObject(2850, 3439, 1306, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2843, 3444, 3037, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2842, 3439, 1308, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2847, 3436, 1309, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2842, 3436, 1307, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2839, 3439, 2091, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2839, 3440, 2095, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2839, 3441, 2093, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2839, 3442, 2097, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2839, 3443, 2103, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2839, 3444, 2105, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2839, 3445, 14860, 0, 10); makeGlobalObject(2839, 3436, 2783, 0, 10);
Then go in your client go to where you want the to put the object :use the command ::mypos
it will give you coordsX and coordsY!

Once you got your coords go back into client.java and make a code look like this!

makeGlobalObject(coordsX, coordsY, objectcode, 0, 10);

make sure O in Object is capital

next to objectcode the is a 0 this means it is facing in a certain way u can turn it around by put -1 -2 etc… wthis will help if u put your object in a certain spot and its facing the wrong way.

Now save compile run

you can also get All the rsps codes at this website:http://rspscodes.synthasite.com/

Thanks

Read full topic
